definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Some light incense sticks at the several little altars all around the temple.
sentences.chinese: 几个插满了香烛的祭坛环绕在寺庙的四周。

sentences.english: The woman turned back to her incense.
sentences.chinese: 那妇人跟着回头对着香烛。

sentences.english: Light an aromatherapy candle or incense.
The smoke only adds to the mysticism of the place.
sentences.chinese: 香烛的烟雾增加了这里的神秘氛围。

sentences.english: The candles on the burner table didn't burn out after a whole night.
sentences.chinese: 整整一夜，香案上的香烛都没有烧完。

sentences.english: Parents have left candles, incense and offerings of fruit by the flagpole.
sentences.chinese: 遇难学生的家长在旗杆旁留下了香烛和水果等祭祀品。

sentences.english: The farmers prayed, giving sacrifices and burning incense to Heaven for deliverance.
sentences.chinese: 农民们祈祷，使牺牲和香烛到天堂的解脱。

definition: ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
joss paper made to resemble paper money
joss paper made to resemble paper money
paper dolls for ritual use in the shape of people or animals
paper ingots (burned as offerings to the dead)
the three sacrificial animals (originally cow, sheep and pig; later pig, chicken and fish)
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
